gcci.text: H100 pricing at $3.15/hr suggests continued supply chain constraints despite capex investments, with chip availability remaining the primary bottleneck for scaling AI infrastructure.

gtpi.text: Token pricing at $1.25/1M signals aggressive API price competition driving efficiency gains, as providers race to optimize models while maintaining competitive margins.

gagl.text: 120 TWh annual load indicates AI infrastructure is pushing grid capacity limits, accelerating the case for nuclear adoption to meet carbon-neutral commitments.

aipi.text: The convergence of hardware scarcity, API price compression, and energy strain suggests a maturing AI market where operational efficiency will separate sustainable growth from bubble risks.
